products.name: 15ml Wild Eucalyptus citriodora

Plant Part: Leaf

Man Found Standing, Medicine Man Practitioner writes: For greater details, see the picture printout from my book. Historically Eucalyptus citriodora has been used to assist in:

  • Expectorant: eliminates mucus, opens breathing passages, relieves asthma
  • Antispasmodic: ease coughs and bronchitis
  • Anti-Inflammatory: aids with joints, sprains, ligaments, and tendons
  • Pain Relief: muscle and shingle pain
  • Fungicidal: eliminates athlete’s foot as well as ringworm
  • Insect Repellant: use to repel bugs and insects
  • Brain: aids in mental exhaustion, purifying the mind, and assisting to feel peace 


Extraction Method: Steam Distillation


Historic Benefits: When the British came to Australia, they planted Eucalyptus trees around their compounds to keep insects away. They would use the leaves in sachets to scent closets and drawers.

 

Blends Well With: Basil, Black Pepper, Cypress, Frankincense, Ginger, Juniper Berry, Marjoram, Peppermint, Pine, Ravintsara, Rosemary, Sage, Tea Tree, Thyme, Vetiver, Ylang Ylang


Precautions: Disinfectant properties increase with age.

Man Found Standing, Medicine Man Practitioner writes: For greater details, see the picture printout from my book. Historically Fennel Seed has been used to assist in:

Historic Benefits: Ancient Egyptians used fennel seeds to prevent the plague and assist digestion. Its essential oil supports good digestive health, has antimicrobial properties, and aids in weight loss.

Precautions: Fennel Seed’s organic element of trans anethole can boost the production of the estrogen hormone. Avoid using during pregnancy or if you have breast cancer or epilepsy. If too much is consumed it may cause convulsions, hallucinations, and mental imbalance.

products.name: 15ml Organic Marjoram
products.description:
Country of Origin: Egypt, Organic

Botanical Name: Origanum marjorana l.

Plant Part: Leaf and Plant

Note: Spicy and Herbaceous



Man Found Standing, Medicine Man Practitioner writes: For greater details, see the picture printout from my book. Historically Marjoram has been used to assist in:

  • Muscles: pain and repair
  • Respiratory: antispasmodic, decongestant, all over respiratory aid
  • General Health Tonic: fights infections in wounds, common cold, food poisoning, keep the brain healthy and active
  • Cardiovascular: atherosclerosis, hypertension, widens and relaxes blood vessels to ease blood flow and lower blood pressure


Extraction Method: Steam Distillation


Historic Benefits: The ancient Greeks used Marjoram to heal from poison, convulsions and edema. They called it “Joy Mountain” and crowned young couples with it during wedding ceremonies. Believed to assist nurture love, it was added to food to promote civility and love. Young women would place marjoram under their pillows at night, believing that the herb would reveal their future husbands while they dreamed. In England, Marjoram was used in beer and tobacco as a preservative and to add a bit of flavor. 


Blends Well With: Basil, Bergamot, Cardamom, Cedarwood, Chamomile, Cypress, Elemi, Eucalyptus, Frankincense, Lavender, Nutmeg, Orange, Tea Tree, Thyme


Precautions: This is a “hot” oil. Use sparingly and in dilution.
